00033 
00034 /*
00035  * xdr_stdio.c, XDR implementation on standard i/o file.
00036  *
00037  * Copyright (C) 1984, Sun Microsystems, Inc.
00038  *
00039  * This set of routines implements a XDR on a stdio stream.
00040  * XDR_ENCODE serializes onto the stream, XDR_DECODE de-serializes
00041  * from the stream.
00042  */
00043 
00044 #include "Types.h"
00045 #include <stdio.h>
00046 #include "Xdr.h"
00047 #ifdef __linux__
00048 #include <netinet/in.h>
00049 #endif
00050 
00051 static bool_t   Xdrstdio_getlong();
00052 static bool_t   Xdrstdio_putlong();
00053 static bool_t   Xdrstdio_getbytes();
00054 static bool_t   Xdrstdio_putbytes();
00055 static u_int    Xdrstdio_getpos();
00056 static bool_t   Xdrstdio_setpos();
00057 static int32_t *Xdrstdio_inline();
00058 static void     Xdrstdio_destroy();
00059 
00060 /*
00061  * Ops vector for stdio type XDR
00062  */
00063 static struct Xdr_ops   Xdrstdio_ops = {
00064         Xdrstdio_getlong,       /* deseraialize a long int */
00065         Xdrstdio_putlong,       /* seraialize a long int */
00066         Xdrstdio_getbytes,      /* deserialize counted bytes */
00067         Xdrstdio_putbytes,      /* serialize counted bytes */
00068         Xdrstdio_getpos,        /* get offset in the stream */
00069         Xdrstdio_setpos,        /* set offset in the stream */
00070         Xdrstdio_inline,        /* prime stream for inline macros */
00071         Xdrstdio_destroy        /* destroy stream */
00072 };
00073 
00074 /*
00075  * Initialize a stdio xdr stream.
00076  * Sets the xdr stream handle xdrs for use on the stream file.
00077  * Operation flag is set to op.
00078  */
00079 void
00080 Xdrstdio_create(xdrs, file, op)
00081         register XDR *xdrs;
00082         FILE *file;
00083         enum Xdr_op op;
00084 {
00085 
00086         xdrs->x_op = op;
00087         xdrs->x_ops = &Xdrstdio_ops;
00088         xdrs->x_private = (caddr_t)file;
00089         xdrs->x_handy = 0;
00090         xdrs->x_base = 0;
00091 }
00092 
00093 /*
00094  * Destroy a stdio xdr stream.
00095  * Cleans up the xdr stream handle xdrs previously set up by xdrstdio_create.
00096  */
00097 static void
00098 Xdrstdio_destroy(xdrs)
00099         register XDR *xdrs;
00100 {
00101         (void)fflush((FILE *)xdrs->x_private);
00102         /* xx should we close the file ?? */
00103 }
00104 
00105 static bool_t
00106 Xdrstdio_getlong(xdrs, lp)
00107         XDR *xdrs;
00108         register long *lp;
00109 {
00110 
00111         if (fread((caddr_t)lp, sizeof(int32_t), 1,
00112             (FILE *)xdrs->x_private) != 1)
00113                 return (FALSE);
00114         *lp = (long)ntohl((int32_t)*lp);
00115         return (TRUE);
00116 }
00117 
00118 static bool_t
00119 Xdrstdio_putlong(xdrs, lp)
00120         XDR *xdrs;
00121         long *lp;
00122 {
00123         long mycopy = (long)htonl((int32_t)*lp);
00124 
00125         if (fwrite((caddr_t)&mycopy, sizeof(int32_t), 1,
00126             (FILE *)xdrs->x_private) != 1)
00127                 return (FALSE);
00128         return (TRUE);
00129 }
00130 
00131 static bool_t
00132 Xdrstdio_getbytes(xdrs, addr, len)
00133         XDR *xdrs;
00134         caddr_t addr;
00135         u_int len;
00136 {
00137 
00138         if ((len != 0) && (fread(addr, (int)len, 1, (FILE *)xdrs->x_private) != 1))
00139                 return (FALSE);
00140         return (TRUE);
00141 }
00142 
00143 static bool_t
00144 Xdrstdio_putbytes(xdrs, addr, len)
00145         XDR *xdrs;
00146         caddr_t addr;
00147         u_int len;
00148 {
00149 
00150         if ((len != 0) && (fwrite(addr, (int)len, 1, (FILE *)xdrs->x_private) != 1))
00151                 return (FALSE);
00152         return (TRUE);
00153 }
00154 
00155 static u_int
00156 Xdrstdio_getpos(xdrs)
00157         XDR *xdrs;
00158 {
00159 
00160         return ((u_int) ftell((FILE *)xdrs->x_private));
00161 }
00162 
00163 static bool_t
00164 Xdrstdio_setpos(xdrs, pos) 
00165         XDR *xdrs;
00166         u_int pos;
00167 { 
00168 
00169         return ((fseek((FILE *)xdrs->x_private, (long)pos, 0) < 0) ?
00170                 FALSE : TRUE);
00171 }
00172 
00173 /* ARGSUSED */
00174 static int32_t *
00175 Xdrstdio_inline(xdrs, len)
00176         XDR *xdrs;
00177         u_int len;
00178 {
00179 
00180         /*
00181          * Must do some work to implement this: must insure
00182          * enough data in the underlying stdio buffer,
00183          * that the buffer is aligned so that we can indirect through a
00184          * long *, and stuff this pointer in xdrs->x_buf.  Doing
00185          * a fread or fwrite to a scratch buffer would defeat
00186          * most of the gains to be had here and require storage
00187          * management on this buffer, so we don't do this.
00188          */
00189         return (NULL);
00190 }
